Records|Warner Bros.]], Paras, Wildcatter, Harms Way Music | associated_acts = | website = {{url|www.joniharms.com}} }} '''Joni Harms''' (born November 5, 1959, in [[Canby, Oregon]]{{cite web|title=Joni Harms|url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=mn0000826378|pure_url=yes}}|work=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=November 11, 2014}}) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Between 1990 and 2011, Harms released eleven studio albums plus her album ''Oregon to Ireland'' recorded live with The Sheerin Family Band in [[Moate]], Ireland and released in 2014. She also charted two singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart. Her highest charting single, "I Need a Wife," peaked at No. 34 in 1989.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2005|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=164|date=2005|isbn=0-89820-165-9}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" !
